title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A judge ruled Shannon O'Brien, ex-chair of the Cannabis Control Commission, must be reinstated after wrongful removal.
State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg accuses O'Brien of misconduct, including race-based remarks; appeals the ruling for a week's delay.
Goldberg's legal expenses exceeded $970,000 in ongoing disputes over O'Brien's commission role, her term ending August 2027.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Police responded to a call on Newhall Street in Lynn and found a 38-year-old woman dead.
A 30-year-old man from Lynn was arrested and charged with murder by Essex County DA Paul Tucker.
The suspect is set for arraignment Monday in Lynn District Court; names not released and court records unavailable.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers, a former Patriots receiver, expressed contentment with the Raiders after his trade request was denied.
Meyers is seeking a new contract in his final deal year, having signed a $33M contract with the Raiders in 2023.
The Raiders' recent win over the Patriots in Foxborough marked Meyers' return to Gillette Stadium with eight catches for 97 yards.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A radar-confirmed tornado touched down in Holden, Massachusetts during a severe storm on Saturday.
The National Weather Service plans to survey tornado damage and determine its path and severity on Monday.
Severe thunderstorm warnings affected areas from Baltimore to northern Maine, including much of Massachusetts.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots lost their season opener to the Raiders 20-13, continuing struggles from previous seasons.
New coach Mike Vrabel couldn't secure a win despite offseason signings like Stefon Diggs and Harold Landry.
Quarterback Drake Maye showed promise early but was ineffective in the second half, echoing past issues.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookie Will Campbell experienced a challenging NFL debut with the Patriots' 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Campbell allowed two sacks and committed two false starts, impacting the Patriots' late-game comeback efforts.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel acknowledged shortcomings across the team and emphasized improving ahead of division play.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Lynn police officer is on leave following video evidence of incapacitation during a traffic stop.
The officer appeared to experience a medical episode, causing slow response and difficulty standing, according to police.
The incident is under investigation, examining all possible factors; body camera footage and medical consultations are being reviewed.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The New England Patriots lost 20-13 to the Las Vegas Raiders in their season opener at Gillette Stadium.
Harold Landry III excelled, recording 2.5 sacks against Raiders quarterback Geno Smith in his Patriots debut.
Patriots' running back performance lagged, with the team totaling 60 rushing yards, and TreVeyon Henderson leading with 27.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys avoided disaster at the rain-delayed Seisiún festival at Suffolk Downs in Boston on September 6, 2025.
A heavy storm caused a two-hour delay, but the concert resumed with fervor, culminating in headliner Dropkick Murphys' performance.
The band engaged with the reduced audience, delivering a high-energy set including songs like 'The Boys Are Back' and 'I’m Shipping Up To Boston.'

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick banned a Patriots scout from UNC practices, citing unwelcomeness at former Patriots facilities.
Belichick's strained relationship with the Patriots follows his exit after a four-win 2023 season.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel stated they will find alternative methods to evaluate UNC players.
